NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
OFFICE OF THE PRESIDENT
Station KTJOM
University of Minnesota
Minneapolis 11+, Minnesota
September 6, 1957
Mr. Frank E. Schooley
WILL
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Frank:
I got back from my three weeks vacation with the
inevitable mountain of mail to answer, and I*m just finishing
it up now as I get ready to go to Washington for a weekTs
television seminar arranged by DAVI of NEA.
I am sorry that you have had to spend some time in bed.
I hope this letter finds you your usual lively self.
I note with interest and approval the hard work that
you have put in on the St. Louis convention. I am taking
with me a bit of NAEB correspondence and material which I
shall read on route. I am planning to confer with Dick
Hull in Columbus on my way to Washington, and in Washington
with Gertrude Broderick, Lennie Marks, and any others who
have things to do in connection with NAEB. This may lead to
a few telephone calls to Harry.
I had a perfectly marvelous vacation with the family,
driving to Oregon and back. We went out via the Badlands,
Black Hills, Bighorns, Yellowstone Park and the Grand
Tetons. We returned via Glacier, and spent six of the seven
nights on the return trip tenting. This proved a somewhat
strenuous but extremely enjoyable and relaxing vacation--
the first real one I*ve had since 1952. I hope that you and
your gang did somewhere as well.
With best personal regards.
Yours sincerely,
BP:ds
Burton Paulu
President
